column10: Driver was probably going around 25, but it felt way faster than ok due to proximity to my 5yo and dog. He didn’t see me until after he was in the crosswalk and probably didn’t see my son or dog due to the height of his vehicle and the parked vehicle.
Driver didn’t seem to realize it wasn’t a 4 way stop and went through after coming to a complete stop. But the other car didn’t have a stop. There was no accident but it was close.

Many drivers assume this corner is a four way stop and creates regular confusion and near misses for drivers in all directions; Car travelling north on La Grande stopped at stop sign but then continued into the path of oncoming vehicle as the driver assumed four-way stop
column21: Car travelling north on La Grande stopped at stop sign but then continued into the path of oncoming vehicle as the driver assumed four-way stop

column10:
I was at this intersection on the way to school with my young kids. The intersection was clear as I told my kids to start crossing when a driver approached the intersection at high speed, ran the stop sign and barreled into the crosswalk going about 20MPH, then stopped about 5 feet into the intersection when I yelled.

Contributing factors:
Speed
Cell phone in driver's hand
Cars parked so close to the crosswalk that we can't see approaching traffic until we are in the intersection.

Suggested mitigation: bulbouts.
column21: I would welcome some traffic enforcement against speeders and people who barrel into the crosswalk, especially at rush hour.
